Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Free form text comment about the attachment.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Attachment Categories.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Element for the attachments pertaining to a Event entered through a web service.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Event Attachments.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Edit_Service_Dates_Business_Process_Data.description: Reference to the Worker.  The service dates specified must be appropriate to the worker type (regular, fixed term, contingent).

validation.validation: There is a Service Dates Change Event in progress for this worker.  Only one Service Dates Change Event may be in progress for a worker.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Original Hire Date in the worker's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Original Hire Date not allowed for contingent workers.
Original Hire Date cannot be greater than either the Hire Date or the earliest Hire Date from previous Hire Events.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: Date that service calculations will use as the start of service. If empty, Workday will use the existing date. When rehiring workers, if you run the Hire Employee and Edit Service Dates EIBs concurrently, you must enter the same Continuous Service Date in both EIBs for each worker.
The Expected Retirement Date in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Expected Retirement Date is not valid for contingent workers.
Expected Retirement Date must be after Hire Date.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Retirement Eligibility Date in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Retirement Eligibility Date is not valid for contingent workers.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The End Employment Date for the position of fixed term or temporary employees. Only applies to an employee's primary position. If the value is given as the sub-process of a main event, it is ignored. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Invalid use of End Employment Date.  End Employment Date is only valid for fixed term employees.
End Employment Date must be after Hire Date.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Seniority Date in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Seniority Date is not allowed for contingent workers.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Severance Date in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Severance Date not allowed for contingent workers.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Contract End Date for the contingent worker's position. Only applies to the worker's primary position. If the value is given in the main process, it is ignored in sub-processes. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Invalid use of Contract End Date.  Contract End Date is only valid for contingent workers.
Contract end date cannot be earlier than contract start date.
The contract end date cannot be changed here because the worker’s primary employment has a Purchase Order. Please use the Edit Position web service to change this field.
validation.description: The contract end date cannot be changed here because the worker’s primary employment has a Purchase Order. Please use the Edit Position web service to change this field.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Benefits Service Date in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date. When rehiring workers, if you run the Hire Employee and Edit Service Dates EIBs concurrently, you must enter the same Benefit Service Date in both EIBs for each worker.

validation.validation: Benefits Service Date is not allowed for contingent workers.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Company Service Date in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date. When rehiring workers, if you run the Hire Employee and Edit Service Dates EIBs concurrently, you must enter the same Company Service Date in both EIBs for each worker.

validation.validation: Company Service Date is not allowed for contingent workers.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Time Off Service Date in the worker's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.
The Vesting Date in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Vesting Date is not allowed for contingent workers.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: The Date Entered Workforce in the employee's service dates. If empty, Workday will use the existing date.

validation.validation: Date Entered Workforce is only allowed for employees in the Countries configured on Tenant Setup.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: Number of days unemployed since the employee first joined the work force. Used only for China.

validation.validation: Days Unemployed is only allowed for employees in China.

Edit_Service_Dates_Event_Data.description: Number of months of continuous prior employment at the employee's most recent job. Used only for China.

validation.validation: Months Continuous Prior Employment is only allowed for employees in China.

Edit_Service_Dates_Business_Process_Data.description: Wrapper element for the Edit Service Dates details.

validation.validation: At least one service date parameter must be specified.

description: Wrapper element for the Edit Service Dates business process web service.
